item.title: Staying connected with the (Turkish) family: the integration criteria for family reunification in Genc
item.description:
Silvia Adamo, Postdoctoral Fellow, bEUcitizen â€“ Barriers to European Citizenship/Faculty of Law, University of Copenhagen This piece examines the expectations for integration placed on Turkish citizens residing in EU Member States seeking family reunification. While the EU Directive on family reunification allows Member States to establish integration requirements, the 2015 CJEU judgment in K and A clarified the limitations of these requirements. Additionally, the 2014 Dogan judgment addressed the standstill clause in the EU-Turkey Association Agreement concerning family reunification for self-employed Turkish nationals...
